TopicTitle: KSP Mentioned by the White House, New Contest?

Articles.Content:
Kerbal Space Program was mentioned by the Official White House website in a post about the astronomy night that Squad was invited to.

"Squad, the developers of the game Kerbal Space Program, will launch a public campaign through Kerbal Space official channels for a girls-focused video production contest in early 2016, which will reach Kerbal SpaceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s user base of more than 1 million people. The contest will highlight incredible feats in space travel by women, and demonstrate how girls and women are solving some of the hardest challenges in astrophysics and space exploration. Winners of the campaign will earn prizes for themselves and their schools."

So a new contest coming about women and space exploration, discuss!

Source:http://www.whitehouse.gov/the-press-office/2015/10/19/fact-sheet-white-house-astronomy-night-president-obama-announces-new

Edited October 20, 2015 by CornHuskerKenny
Hey, that's pretty cool! I knew adding the female kerbals was a huge step in the right direction!
So, I guess the POTUS doesn't know that the only female Kerbal doesn't have a glass faceplate on her helmet (in the menu screen)?

So, I guess the POTUS doesn't know that the only female Kerbal doesn't have a glass faceplate on her helmet (in the menu screen)?

The ONLY female kerbal? My save is populated almost entirely by female Kerbals, since that's all that seems to spawn for rescue missions.

That's dead good, well done folks - always been impressed with the attention Squad put towards education editions and the like.

Katie Mack & Emily Lakdawalla are two astro-physics lady people off the top of my head who may prove inspirational / educational / worth approaching for advice / collaboration.

Don't derail the thread please, we know Vals helmet glass is too transparent, endlessly calling attention to it isn't going to get it fixed any sooner.

Now stay on topic, thank you.

The ONLY female kerbal? My save is populated almost entirely by female Kerbals, since that's all that seems to spawn for rescue missions.

That's a bug with the Asteroid Day DLC apparently

Hey, this is still good for Squad!

Removed political discussion.

Yay for SQUAD.

I have to say that as an outside observer it's great to see something this positive issued from the U.S. White House.

Happy landings!
A good sized comunity being mentioned by the White House WOOT WOOT. It should be a program used in school!

A good sized comunity being mentioned by the White House WOOT WOOT. It should be a program used in school!
They're probably gonna use it to campaign for STEM.

Seriously, every year everyone hypes about STEM. They haven't even implemented it in half the nation....

Am I understanding this right? Only girls will be able to participate in the 2016 competitions? Or can all genders participate, but they will highlight more females than males. If its like that, then I'm down. I'd love to win something for my school by doing something that I love. Kinda requires that I get good at the game first though...
My School is not behind. Really good public schools.... Also even with KSP in schools 1/2 of the kids will be messing around with it like killing kerbals.

Well, when the contest rules are released "in early 2016", you will know for sure

It's still a couple months until then though.

KSP really has grown from a simple game with only one objective to...well, this.
